ExtensionsConfig.description:
The Firebase Extensions that should be deployed to this project.
This is a map of instance ID to extension reference (<publisherId>/<extensionId>@<version>)- ie:
"my-firestore-export": "firebase/firestore-bigquery-export@1.2.3"

Version can also be a semver range.

FirestoreSingle.description: Deployment options for a single Firestore database.

database.description: The id of the Firestore database to deploy. If omitted, defaults to '(default)'

indexes.description: Path to the firestore indexes file

location.description: The region of the Firestore database to deploy. Required when 'database' is set.

postdeploy.description: A script or list of scripts that will be ran after this product is deployed.

predeploy.description: A script or list of scripts that will be ran before this product is deployed.

rules.description: Path to the firestore rules file

concurrency.description: Number of requests a function can serve at once.

cors.description:
If true, allows CORS on requests to this function.
If this is a `string` or `RegExp`, allows requests from domains that match the provided value.
If this is an `Array`, allows requests from domains matching at least one entry of the array.
Defaults to true for {@link https.CallableFunction} and false otherwise.

cpu.description: Fractional number of CPUs to allocate to a function.

enforceAppCheck.description: Determines whether Firebase AppCheck is enforced. Defaults to false.

ingressSettings.description: Ingress settings which control where this function can be called from.

invoker.description: Invoker to set access control on https functions.

labels.description: User labels to set on the function.

maxInstances.description: Max number of instances to be running in parallel.

memory.description: Amount of memory to allocate to a function.

minInstances.description: Min number of actual instances to be running at a given time.

omit.description: If true, do not deploy or emulate this function.

preserveExternalChanges.description: Controls whether function configuration modified outside of function source is preserved. Defaults to false.

region.description: HTTP functions can override global options and can specify multiple regions to deploy to.

serviceAccount.description: Specific service account for the function to run as.

timeoutSeconds.description:
Timeout for the function in seconds, possible values are 0 to 540.
HTTPS functions can specify a higher timeout.

vpcConnector.description: Connect cloud function to specified VPC connector.

codebase.description:
The codebase that these functions are part of. You can use codebases to control which functions are deployed
 ie: `firebase deploy --only functions:my-codebase`

ignore.description: Files in the source directory that should not be uploaed during dpeloyment.

postdeploy.description: A script or list of scripts that will be ran after this product is deployed.

predeploy.description: A script or list of scripts that will be ran before this product is deployed.

runtime.description: The runtime these functions should use.

source.description:
The directory containing your functions source code.
This directory will be archived and uploaded during deployment.
Files outside of this directory will not be included and should not be referenced from your functions code.

pinTag.description: If true, traffic will be pinned to the currently running version of the Cloud Run service.

serviceId.description: The ID of the Cloud Run service to rewrite to.

description:
Information about the resources in your Firebase project.
This used for declarative deployments via `firebase deploy` and local emulation via `firebase emulators:start`

$schema.description: Unused. Included in schema so that the schema can be applied to single files.

alwaysDeployFromSource.description: If true, this backend will only be deployed from local source, not from source control.

If the --import flag is used, the current data will be overwritten by the imported data.
